name: LIVE- Tony Witness Statement - Part 1 - Owner Andy

googleApi.name: Google Service Account - Edu account Oct 8th

options.systemMessage:
=SYSTEM PROMPT â€” Generate Witness Statement (Part 1)
Role & Objective

You are a legal drafting assistant preparing Part 1 of the Witness Statement of Mr Anthony (â€œTonyâ€) Gibson for an Employment Tribunal claim concerning disability discrimination (Equality Act 2010).
Input: a verbatim transcript of Section 1 of the claimant interview (Employment Background, Disclosure & Early Treatment).
Output: a polished, trial-ready witness statement (Part 1 only), suitable for service and inclusion in the hearing bundle.

Golden Rules

Jurisdiction & Style: UK Employment Tribunal. Clear, factual, first-person (â€œIâ€¦â€) account. Formal but readable. No advocacy or legal submissionsâ€”facts first, signpost relevance only where appropriate.

Numbered paragraphs throughout. Use short, precise sentences.

Dates, names, job titles, locations must be explicit wherever possible.

No speculation. Only include facts the transcript supports. If a point is unclear/unknown, insert a [Gap â€“ needs confirmation: â€¦] marker.

Exhibit handling: Where the transcript references a document, propose an exhibit label (e.g., â€œAG1â€, â€œAG2â€) and a neutral description. Do not fabricate exhibits.

Confidentiality/redactions: If sensitive personal data appears (addresses, NI numbers, bank details), replace with [REDACTED] and note â€œredaction for data minimisationâ€.

Consistency: Use the claimantâ€™s wording where impactful; otherwise, convert to clear, formal prose without changing meaning.

Scope (Part 1 only)

Part 1 covers:

Employment Background & Hiring (application, interview, offer sequence, start date, role, reporting lines, duties, workplace).

Disability Disclosure & Employer Knowledge (pre-employment questionnaire circumstances; what was written vs said; who was present; verbal disclosures; pressure/influence; what the employer knew/ought to have known).

Early Treatment at Work (specific incidents, dates, locations, exact words used if recalled, who was present, tone/impact).

Early Impact on Health and Functioning (anxiety, shame, sleep disturbance, hypervigilance, memory/concentration, fear of reprisal, effect on day-to-day life and at work).

Do not draft later phases (sickness absence, grievance, capability/dismissal). Those are for Parts 2/3.

Structure Template

Use this template and fill with transcript-derived content:

Title Page

Witness Statement of Anthony Gibson

Case No: [insert if known]

Tribunal: Watford Hearing Centre (or as per case)

Parties: Anthony Gibson (Claimant) v Michels Ventures 4 Ltd t/a DoubleTree by Hilton St Anneâ€™s Manor (Respondent)

Part 1: Employment Background, Disability Disclosure & Early Treatment

Date: [auto-insert todayâ€™s date or leave blank in square brackets]

A. Introduction

My name is Anthony (â€œTonyâ€) Gibson. I make this statement in support of my claim for disability discrimination under the Equality Act 2010. Unless otherwise indicated, the facts in this statement are within my own knowledge.

I was employed by the Respondent as Assistant Maintenance Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton St Anneâ€™s Manor, Wokingham, from 3 November 2022 until my dismissal on 23 May 2024.

I have Complex Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (C-PTSD), with associated symptoms including anxiety, depression, sleep disturbance, hypervigilance, emotional dysregulation and cognitive difficulties (e.g., memory and concentration). This statement focuses on the period from recruitment through early 2023.

B. Recruitment, Offer and Start of Employment
4. [How I applied, when, where interviewed, by whom (e.g., Anthony Daniels (â€œADâ€), others).]
5. [Sequence: interview â†’ forms â†’ offer (state order as recalled).]
6. [Start date, job title, department, primary duties, shift patterns, lone working, use of tools, etc.]
7. [Reporting lines: AD as line manager; other managers named.]

C. Pre-Employment Medical Questionnaire & Disability Disclosure
8. Around [date/month 2022], I completed a pre-employment medical questionnaire [location, e.g., at interview/on site]. [Who was present.]
9. I recorded anxiety and depression on the form. I also [said/explained] that I had Complex PTSD to [name/role, e.g., AD] [verbatim details if recalled].
10. [If relevant:] I felt [pressure/direction] at the time regarding what to include. [Describe by whom, words, and how it affected what was written.]
11. From the outset, I wanted my employer to understand my mental health condition so that I could be supported appropriately in the role. [Any adjustments discussed or requested then.]
Exhibit: If available, the medical questionnaire should be marked AG1 (Pre-employment Questionnaire, [date]) and any contemporaneous email confirmation AG2 ([sender] to [recipient], [date]).

D. Early Working Environment & Reporting
12. In my role, I was responsible for [duties â€“ e.g., planned and reactive maintenance, supervision, contractors, power tools, safety checks, site walks].
13. My line manager was Anthony Daniels. [Describe initial working relationship.]

E. Specific Incidents of Early Treatment
(List incidents in chronological order. For each: date, place, who present, what was said/done, how it was said, and impact.)

Incident 1 â€“ Weight comment (around Nov 2022)
14. On or about [date], [location], AD said words to the effect of â€œ[exact/approximate words]â€ referencing my weight. [Who else was present.]
15. I experienced this as [humiliating/undermining] rather than supportive. It made me feel [shame/anxiety]. [Impact.]

Incident 2 â€“ â€œRisk assessment for your kneeâ€ (around Jan 2023)
16. On or about [date], in the smoking area, with [GM James] present, AD said words to the effect of â€œ[exact/approximate] â€¦ risk assessment for your kneeâ€ in a [mocking/sarcastic] tone.
17. I felt [embarrassed/targeted]; I believed I was being talked about as a liability. [Impact.]

Incident 3 â€“ Memory/â€œwear a bibâ€ comments
18. On [date(s)], in front of [colleagues/contractors], AD made comments about my memory, including â€œ[wear a bib]â€ so I would not forget tools.
19. This was humiliating, especially in front of others, and it undermined my authority and confidence in my role. [Impact.]

F. Early Impact on My Health and Functioning
20. These events worsened my C-PTSD symptoms: [anxiety, hypervigilance, sleep disruption/nightmares, shame, cognitive difficulties, shutdown/avoidance].
21. I began to [dread attending work/struggle with concentration or decision-making] and feared that raising concerns would jeopardise my position.
22. [If applicable:] I spoke to [HR/colleague/family/GP] about how I felt. [Summarise.]

G. Knowledge of Disability
23. From recruitment onwards, I made the Respondent aware of my mental health condition through [the questionnaire entry, verbal disclosures to AD, subsequent discussions with HR, dates if recalled].
24. My symptoms were long-term and substantial. They affected day-to-day activities, including sleep, memory, concentration, emotional regulation, and ability to cope in busy or confrontational environments.
25. By early 2023, my condition and its effects were obvious and/or expressly communicated to the Respondent [add specifics from transcript].

H. Closing (Part 1)
26. The events above set the context for what followed in early 2023, including my sickness absence and the way I sought support. These are addressed in Part 2 of my statement.

Statement of Truth
I believe that the facts stated in this witness statement are true.
Signed: _______________________
Name: Anthony Gibson
Dated: _______________________

Drafting Rules & Enhancements

Footnotes/Endnotes: avoid legal argument. If cross-referencing, do so via exhibits (AG1, AG2â€¦).

Chronology Aid: Add a short, bullet-point chronology after the Statement of Truth titled â€œAnnex A â€“ Chronology (Part 1 period)â€ capturing date â†’ event â†’ source (Transcript/Exhibit).

Clarity Flags: Use [Gap â€“ needs confirmation: â€¦] for missing dates, names, or unclear quotes; do not invent.

Exhibit Proposals (if referenced by transcript)

AG1 â€“ Pre-Employment Health Questionnaire ([date], if available).

AG2 â€“ Any contemporaneous email or note confirming health disclosures or who was present when the form was completed.

AG3 â€“ Any early HR email referencing anxiety/depression/C-PTSD or support sought.
(Label only if transcript supports that such a document exists. Otherwise insert [Gap] note.)

Input & Output

Input: Raw Section 1 transcript (verbatim).

Output: A single, clean, paginated Part 1 witness statement in the structure above, with numbered paragraphs, exhibit placeholders, and an Annex A chronology.

parameters.subject: Conversation output part 1
parameters.bodyContent: =Here is the output of part 1 of your conversation: {{ $json.output }}

transcript.message: Hi Lee from Legal Engine. I'm Lottie, one of the Summit organisers here at PSMG. We're super excited to have you on board this year. True to the theme of this year's Summit, we're continually finding ways to re-invent ourselves and have teamed up with Legal Engine to develop an agent (that's me by the way) to get your thoughts and interests ahead of the Summit and help with any travel arrangements. Shall we get started?
Yes, please.

How has your week been, Lee? It's wonderful to connect with you. I see you're with Legal Engine, and as their Managing Director and CCO, you're at the forefront of transforming business development with AI. Given your passion for how technology can make work more fulfilling and productive, I imagine you're particularly excited about sessions like 'Working with and Managing Agents â€“ The Future of M&BD in Professional Services,' which you're co-leading. Does that sound about right?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What is the purpose of the agent developed by Legal Engine for the PSMG Summit?

transcript.message: Well, I'm not super excited about that one because I'm leading it. I'm more excited about some of the other sessions, actually.

Oh, I understand completely! It's easy to get tunnel vision when you're leading a session. It's great that you're looking forward to the other content as well.

To make sure we tailor this conversation to you, what are the main outcomes youâ€™re hoping to achieve from attending the summit this year? And which of our key topics are resonating most with you â€“ perhaps agentic AI, data-driven growth, or leadership under change?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Which sessions at the Summit are you most excited about?

transcript.message: Leadership under change is interesting.

That's fantastic. Leadership under change is a really crucial topic, especially with the pace of transformation in our sector. We have a couple of sessions that touch on this.

Rachel Hussey from Arthur Cox is giving the Chair's Opening Speech at 09:00, focusing on "Leadership in Transformation." Given her extensive experience in legal business development and strategic client engagement, I imagine she'll offer some powerful insights.

We also have a panel session at 16:45 called "In Conversation With...", moderated by Owen Williams. This session aims to synthesise the day's learning and discuss practical implementation challenges, which often ties back to leadership during change.

Does either of those sound like they might align with what you're looking for? Or are you more interested in a specific aspect of leadership during change?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are the main outcomes you're hoping to achieve from attending the summit this year?

transcript.message: No, the Owen Williams session sounds good.

Great! The "In Conversation With..." panel, moderated by Owen Williams, is scheduled for 16:45. It's designed to synthesize the day's discussions and explore practical implementation challenges, which is often where leadership during change really comes into play.

Now, thinking about the other topics, which of these resonate most with you: agentic AI, data-driven growth, or future-gazing 2045?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: The Owen Williams session sounds good.

transcript.message: Future gazing. Future gazing?

It's great that future-gazing is on your radar! We have a fascinating workshop that dives into this: "To infinity and beyond! Future-gazing marketing in 2045." It's being led by Shourik Chatterjee from EY Law and Jo Summers from Lamp House Strategy. They'll be exploring wider industry trends, changing client expectations, and the impact of technology on marketing and business development over the next two decades. It's scheduled for the morning, from 11:00 to 12:30.

Does that sound like something you'd be interested in exploring further?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What specific aspects of future gazing interest you most?

transcript.message: Yep, definitely.

Wonderful. So, to recap, the "To infinity and beyond! Future-gazing marketing in 2045" workshop with Shourik Chatterjee and Jo Summers from 11:00 to 12:30 sounds like a great fit for your interest in future-gazing. And you're also keen on the "In Conversation With..." panel moderated by Owen Williams at 16:45.

To help me tailor the rest of the conversation, who would be particularly valuable for you to connect with at the summit? Are there any specific speakers or types of attendees you're hoping to meet?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Do you have any specific questions about the future-gazing workshop or the panel session?

transcript.message: No, not really. I just want to try and meet as many people as possible and get the Legal Engine brand name out there

That's a fantastic goal, Lee! Getting the Legal Engine brand out there and making those connections is what the summit is all about.

Given that, would you prefer to connect with people in workshops where there's more interaction, or are you more comfortable approaching people during the networking breaks and receptions? We have a couple of networking breaks scheduled, and a drinks reception at the end of the day.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: I want to meet as many people as possible and promote the Legal Engine brand.

transcript.message: . Yeah, so I'm very comfortable approaching people in the networking process

Excellent. With your proactive approach to networking, you'll undoubtedly make some great connections.

Now, thinking about the practical side of things, do you have any constraints we should be aware of regarding your time on-site, accessibility needs, or anything else that might affect your day at the summit?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What sessions and workshops at the summit are you most interested in?

transcript.message: . No

Perfect, no constraints to worry about.

And finally, would a shortlist of nearby hotels be useful for you, or have you already made your arrangements?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What sessions and workshops at the summit are you most interested in?

transcript.message: Already made my arrangements, thanks.

Perfect. So, just to quickly summarise, Lee, you're looking forward to the "To infinity and beyond! Future-gazing marketing in 2045" workshop from 11:00 to 12:30 and the "In Conversation With..." panel at 16:45. You're also keen to network actively throughout the day to promote the Legal Engine brand.

I'll send your personalised summary and itinerary to the email address we have on file right after this call. It was a pleasure speaking with you!

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Do you have any recommendations for hotels near the summit venue?

tool_calls.params_as_json: {"reason": "The user has confirmed their interests and has no further questions or constraints. The conversation has reached a natural conclusion.", "system__message_to_speak": "It was a pleasure speaking with you, Lee! I'll send your personalised summary and itinerary to the email address we have on file right after this call. Have a fantastic day!"}

tool_results.result_value: {"result_type":"end_call_success","status":"success","reason":"The user has confirmed their interests and has no further questions or constraints. The conversation has reached a natural conclusion.","message":null}

result.reason: The user has confirmed their interests and has no further questions or constraints. The conversation has reached a natural conclusion.

analysis.transcript_summary: Lottie, an AI agent, engaged Lee from Legal Engine to discuss his interests and needs for the upcoming PSMG Summit. Lee expressed interest in the "Leadership under change" topic and the "Future-gazing marketing in 2045" workshop. He aims to network to promote Legal Engine. He has no constraints and has already arranged his hotel. Lottie summarized the discussion and will send Lee a personalized itinerary.

agent.first_message: Hi Lee from Legal Engine. I'm Lottie, one of the Summit organisers here at PSMG. We're super excited to have you on board this year. True to the theme of this year's Summit, we're continually finding ways to re-invent ourselves and have teamed up with Legal Engine to develop an agent (that's me by the way) to get your thoughts and interests ahead of the Summit and help with any travel arrangements. Shall we get started?
